newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: EU invites members to withdraw ambassadors in Iran.
newsitem.headline: EU invites members to withdraw ambassadors in Iran.

text.p: The European Union said on Thursday it was inviting all member states to recall their ambassadors from Iran following a German court ruling accusing Iranian leaders of ordering the killing of exiled Kurds.
Germany on Thursday ordered four Iranian diplomats out of the country after a Berlin court accused Iran's leaders of ordering the killing of exiled Kurdish dissidents in Berlin.
The court indicated Iran's highest leaders were involved.

"In the findings of the superior court of justice in Berlin in the so-called Mykonos case, the involvement of Iranian authorities was established. This is condemned and we regard such behaviour as totally unacceptable in the conduct of international affairs," Dutch Foreign Ministry spokesman Peter Mollema told Reuters.
He said that the EU had invited member states to recall their ambassadors for consultations and had not ordered them out of Teheran. Germany has already recalled its ambassador.
The Netherlands holds the presidency of the European Union until the end of June.
